long_desc.thetext:
Latest upstream release: 1.6.1
Current version/release in rawhide: 1.5.2-15.fc24
URL: https://mackyle.github.io/xar/

Please consult the package updates policy before you issue an update to a stable branch: https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Updates_Policy

More information about the service that created this bug can be found at: https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Upstream_release_monitoring

Please keep in mind that with any upstream change, there may also be packaging changes that need to be made. Specifically, please remember that it is your responsibility to review the new version to ensure that the licensing is still correct and that no non-free or legally problematic items have been added upstream.

Based on the information from anitya:  https://release-monitoring.org/project/5156/
An HTTP error occurred downloading the package's new Source URLs: Getting http://xar.googlecode.com/files/xar-1.6.1.tar.gz to ./xar-1.6.1.tar.gz

Tracker bug for Fedora 28 mass rebuild FTBFS

There was a bug in the rel-eng script during the F28 mass rebuild.
And the FTBFS bz bug was not opened for some packages, e.g.:

nawk:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/buglist.cgi?product=Fedora&component=nawk
https://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/packageinfo?packageID=11025

mc:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/buglist.cgi?product=Fedora&component=mc
https://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/packageinfo?packageID=144


and others....

This message is a reminder that Fedora 28 is nearing its end of life.
On 2019-May-28 Fedora will stop maintaining and issuing updates for
Fedora 28. It is Fedora's policy to close all bug reports from releases
that are no longer maintained. At that time this bug will be closed as
EOL if it remains open with a Fedora 'version' of '28'.

Package Maintainer: If you wish for this bug to remain open because you
plan to fix it in a currently maintained version, simply change the 'version' 
to a later Fedora version.

Thank you for reporting this issue and we are sorry that we were not 
able to fix it before Fedora 28 is end of life. If you would still like 
to see this bug fixed and are able to reproduce it against a later version 
of Fedora, you are encouraged  change the 'version' to a later Fedora 
version prior this bug is closed as described in the policy above.

Although we aim to fix as many bugs as possible during every release's 
lifetime, sometimes those efforts are overtaken by events. Often a 
more recent Fedora release includes newer upstream software that fixes 
bugs or makes them obsolete.

Fedora 28 changed to end-of-life (EOL) status on 2019-05-28. Fedora 28 is
no longer maintained, which means that it will not receive any further
security or bug fix updates. As a result we are closing this bug.

If you can reproduce this bug against a currently maintained version of
Fedora please feel free to reopen this bug against that version. If you
are unable to reopen this bug, please file a new report against the
current release. If you experience problems, please add a comment to this
bug.

Thank you for reporting this bug and we are sorry it could not be fixed.

Your package xar failed to build from source in current F28.

https://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/taskinfo?taskID=24902668

For details on mass rebuild see https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Fedora_28_Mass_Rebuild
1.6.1 should fix it: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1476402

Tracker bug for Fedora 30 mass rebuild FTBFS

DEBUG util.py:492:  Downloading Packages:
DEBUG util.py:490:  BUILDSTDERR: Error: Error downloading packages:
DEBUG util.py:490:  BUILDSTDERR:   Cannot download toplink/packages/shadow-utils/4.6/7.fc30/armv7hl/shadow-utils-4.6-7.fc30.armv7hl.rpm: All mirrors were tried
DEBUG util.py:634:  Child return code was: 1

First fix the infrastructure, then start filing FTBFS bugs. Thanks.
Sorry, wrong bug

This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 31 development cycle.
Changing version to '31'.
Fedora 30 is eol and this no longer applies. Please fix these in later releases.

xar failed to build from source in Fedora rawhide/f30

https://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/taskinfo?taskID=32509631


For details on the mass rebuild see:

https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Fedora_30_Mass_Rebuild
Please fix xar at your earliest convenience and set the bug's status to
ASSIGNED when you start fixing it. If the bug remains in NEW state for 8 weeks,
xar will be orphaned. Before branching of Fedora 31,
xar will be retired, if it still fails to build.

For more details on the FTBFS policy, please visit:
https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Fails_to_build_from_source

bugs.title: Review Request: xar - The eXtensible ARchiver

bugzilla.short_desc: Review Request: xar - The eXtensible ARchiver

long_desc.thetext:
Spec URL: https://src.fedoraproject.org/rpms/xar/raw/f30/f/xar.spec
SRPM URL: https://kojipkgs.fedoraproject.org//work/tasks/3945/40033945/xar-1.6.1-1.fc30.src.rpm
Description: The eXtensible ARchiver
Fedora Account System Username: moceap

This review fro unretire xar:

https://pagure.io/releng/issue/9139
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2020-d51db51889
https://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/taskinfo?taskID=40033940

LICENSE must be marked as %license.

Since this is a re-review for a retirement because of a FTBFS issue, just a quick review:

+ package name is still OK
+ license still OK
+ builds and installs OK
+ fedora-review finds no issues (except the missing %license use noted above)
+ P/R/BR look OK

Package is APPROVED.

> LICENSE must be marked as %license.

Ok

> Package is APPROVED.

Thanx

comments.text: This update has been submitted for testing by moceap.
This update's test gating status has been changed to 'waiting'.
This update's test gating status has been changed to 'ignored'.
This update has been pushed to testing.
This update can be pushed to stable now if the maintainer wishes
This update has been submitted for stable by bodhi.
This update has been pushed to stable.

notes:
- Update to 1.6.1
- Change upstream
- Exclude CVE-2010-0055 patch, includes in upstream
- Exclude norpath patch, using sed
- Pass FTBFS state #1676224
- General clean of the spec
- Use Fedora guide lines in Source URL
